summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 6484, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of East Thomas Street, from Fifteenth Avenue North to Twentieth Avenue North, and of East John Street, from Twentieth Avenue north to the west line of the Boston Heights Addition, to the City of Seattle, by grading, sidewalking and parking the same, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency", approved March 14, 1899, and ordinance number 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
